::English::
===========
Title: Paths of Glory (1957)
Genre: Belize. Drama | World War I
Director: Stanley Kubrick
Length: 86 min
Cast: Kirk Douglas, Ralph Meeker, Adolphe Menjou, Goerge MacReady, Wayne Morris, Richard Anderson, Joseph Turkel, Timothy Carey, Peter Capell
Music: Gerald Fried
Screenplay: Stanley Kubrick, Calder Willingham and Jim Thompson (based on the novel Paths of Glory by Humphrey Cobb)
Photo: Georg Krause
Studio: MGM presents a production Bryna Productions

Synopsis:
During the First World War, General Boulard ordered the taking of a German position. This instructs the task to the General Mireau orders Colonel Dax who head up the attack. The mission is a failure and the high command, angered by the defeat, he decides to teach a lesson to the soldiers.

Anecdotes and trivia

1 - For its premiere in Spain was not until 1986 when a retrospective of the director.
2 - The film had problems when it was released in Europe.
3 - The main fault that the project proceed was Kirk Douglas, who read the script and supported him. Then the United Artists studios awarded a small budget the film.
4 - The film was shot in Germany at the difficulties of shooting the film in the U.S. or France.
5 - The script was rejected by several producers in Hollywood.
6 - His projection, in 1958, in Brussels, major incidents triggered by pressure from the French authorities and associations of former French and Belgian soldiers, who refused to accept the image that was projected in the French army. The pressures of the French consulate got to suspend the screening of the film, which in turn ignited the antiwar protests.
French informal pressures that United Artists got called to the suspension of the projection to insert an explanatory note and the hymn of the Marseillaise at the beginning of the film. With this addition, the film re-designed in Brussels.
Switzerland, however, banned the showing, and the United Artists just do not dare to present the film in France until 1972. He was finally released in France during 1975.

======================
Video: Pal 1.33:1, 4:3
Audios: Mono: English, Spanish, French, German, Italian
Subtitles: Spanish, French, Italian, Dutch, English for deaf people, German for deaf
Extras: Interactive Menus, Scene Access, Original Film Trailer
